Subseries VIII. D. Bills and Ledgers

The subseries consists of Henry R. Luce and Clare Boothe Luce's invoices, expense account statements with attached receipts, and other types of bills for housing, clothing, jewelry, office supplies, membership dues, services rendered, petty cash expenses, utilities, repairs, dry cleaning, shopping, insurance and other personal expenses mostly from Arizona, New York and Connecticut. Some of the bills are from schools where Clare Boothe Luce provided financial assistance to students. Correspondence consists of requests for payment, letters of acknowledgement for payment received, brief notes typed on index cards regarding bills, and a small amount of personal correspondence mostly consisting of letters of gratitude, invitations, condolences, and well-wishes. There are also a number of financial ledgers.
